name: Platform Administration and Tivian Access Training
title: Platform Administration and Tivian Access Training
body:
Platform Administration Overview

The Platform Administration section covers the administrative tools and options in the EFS system, focusing on the menu bar in the upper right corner of the interface.

You’re already familiar with creating users—refer to the Users article for more details on available options.

Action items

  • Review the Options article to understand the different administrative tools in the EFS module.
    • Navigate through all menu items to get familiar with them.
  • All access within DXI (EFS) modules is managed by ACL Rights. You’ll receive quite a few tickets related to this.
    • Review the ACL Rights presentation to build a solid understanding.
    • For further reference,  the Overview of ACL Rights article is also a great resource to review and have handy.

Tivian Access Overview

Tivian Access is a security module that can be integrated into existing SSO infrastructure to mitigate bad password habits and enhance the overall security of Tivian applications.

Action items

Go over the below 2 items, providing a basic understanding of this feature.

  • Tivian Access
  • Tivian Access Architectural Overview

We also use Okta as an optional module in EFS. It is an Identity Provider that is used to implement SSO capabilities. Users are synced to this provider. Okta is:

  • an SSO SaaS provider

  • Identity provider for EFS and Portal accounts

  • Individually set up by 2nd level support for customers using EFS IdentityAccessManager module

A good number of our customers use it, and a detailed troubleshooting guide for OKTA would be covered in the Platform Cockpit/troubleshooting/Logs module.
